channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Hezbollah Vows "All Forms Of Support" To Iran Amid Conflict With Israel

media:content.media:description: The United States continues to urge Lebanon to disarm Hezbollah as the Iran-Israel conflict deepens.

item.description: Hezbollah leader Sheikh Naim Qassem has pledged "all forms of support" to Iran in its fight against Israel and the United States, saying Iran's nuclear program is peaceful and aims to serve its people, The Jerusalem Post reported.
item.content:encoded: Hezbollah leader Sheikh Naim Qassem has pledged "all forms of support" to Iran in its fight against Israel and the United States, saying Iran's nuclear program is peaceful and aims to serve its people, The Jerusalem Post reported.

item.title: Iran Appoints New Revolutionary Guards Intelligence Chief

media:content.media:description: Israel killed several top Iranian officials since war began last week on Friday.

item.description: Iran appointed a new chief of intelligence at its Revolutionary Guards on Thursday, the official Irna news agency said, after his predecessor was killed in an Israeli strike last week.
item.content:encoded: Iran appointed a new chief of intelligence at its Revolutionary Guards on Thursday, the official Irna news agency said, after his predecessor was killed in an Israeli strike last week.

item.title: "So Sad": Israelis Shocked By Iran Strike On Hospital

media:content.media:description: Iran's powerful missile hit srael's Soroka Hospital on Thursday.

item.description: The damage was hard to comprehend for many at Israel's Soroka Hospital as staff took stock of the wreckage after a strike by an Iranian ballistic missile on Thursday left part of the facility in ruins.
item.content:encoded: The damage was hard to comprehend for many at Israel's Soroka Hospital as staff took stock of the wreckage after a strike by an Iranian ballistic missile on Thursday left part of the facility in ruins.

item.title: Satellite Imagery Reveals Damage At Iran's Nuclear, Military Sites

media:content.media:description: Israel has carried out precision air strikes against Iran's nuclear facilities and military sites.

item.description: In a calculated show of force, Israel has struck deep inside Iranian territory, targeting a series of high-value nuclear and military installations.

item.title: Netanyahu Says Son's Wedding Delay A "Personal Cost" Of War, Stuns Israelis

media:content.media:description: Netanyahu is facing fierce backlash after citing the delay of his son's wedding as a "personal cost"

item.description: Speaking solemnly in front of a missile-damaged Soroka Hospital in Be'er Sheva, Netanyahu invoked the spirit of Britain during the Blitz, likening Israel's current crisis to the World War II bombings.
item.content:encoded: Speaking solemnly in front of a missile-damaged Soroka Hospital in Be'er Sheva, Netanyahu invoked the spirit of Britain during the Blitz, likening Israel's current crisis to the World War II bombings.

item.title: In A First, Trump Says Leaders Of India And Pakistan Ended Conflict

media:content.media:description: The US president was also effusive in lauding Prime Minister Narendra Modi (File)

item.description: Two "very smart" leaders of India and Pakistan decided to end last month's conflict that could have turned into a nuclear war, US President Donald Trump said.
item.content:encoded: Two "very smart" leaders of India and Pakistan decided to end last month's conflict that could have turned into a nuclear war, US President Donald Trump said.

item.title: Explained: Nuclear Contamination Risks From Israel's Attacks On Iran

media:content.media:description: Israel said on Wednesday it had targeted Arak, also known as Khondab.

item.description: Israel says it is determined to destroy Iran's nuclear capabilities in its military campaign, but that it also wants to avoid any nuclear disaster in a region that is home to tens of millions of people and produces much of the world's oil.
item.content:encoded: Israel says it is determined to destroy Iran's nuclear capabilities in its military campaign, but that it also wants to avoid any nuclear disaster in a region that is home to tens of millions of people and produces much of the world's oil.

item.title: Europe, Iran Try Diplomacy As US Weighs In On Military Response

media:content.media:description: The meeting in Geneva could also provide opportunity to reach out to Iran.

item.description: Iran's foreign minister will meet in Geneva on Friday with counterparts from Germany, France and the United Kingdom, Iranian state media and European diplomats said, as Israeli strikes target country'snuclearand military sites andIran fires back.
item.content:encoded: Iran's foreign minister will meet in Geneva on Friday with counterparts from Germany, France and the United Kingdom, Iranian state media and European diplomats said, as Israeli strikes target country'snuclearand military sites andIran fires back.

item.title: Trump To Make Iran Decision "Within 2 Weeks", Says White House: 10 Points

media:content.media:description: A destroyed building at the site of an Iranian missile attack in Ramat Gan in central Israel

item.description: The Iran Military has confirmed in a statement on Telegram that it has begun a "new round of combined missile and drone attacks" on military sites in Haifa and Tel Aviv.
item.content:encoded: The Iran Military has confirmed in a statement on Telegram that it has begun a "new round of combined missile and drone attacks" on military sites in Haifa and Tel Aviv.

item.title: Trump Extends Deadline To Sell TikTok To Non-Chinese Buyer In US By 90 Days

media:content.media:description: TikTok on Thursday welcomed Trump's decision.

item.description: President Donald Trump announced Thursday he had given social media platform TikTok another 90 days to find a non-Chinese buyer or be banned in the United States.
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump announced Thursday he had given social media platform TikTok another 90 days to find a non-Chinese buyer or be banned in the United States.

item.title: Bangladesh Declares National Holiday To Mark Year Of Sheikh Hasina Ouster

media:content.media:description: August 5 will mark one year of Sheikh Hasina's ouster as Bangladesh Prime Minister

item.description: August 5 will mark a year since the ouster of the Sheikh Hasina government in Bangladesh. To mark the event, the interim government has decided to observe the day as Student-People's Uprising Day and declare it a nationwide public holiday.
item.content:encoded: August 5 will mark a year since the ouster of the Sheikh Hasina government in Bangladesh. To mark the event, the interim government has decided to observe the day as Student-People's Uprising Day and declare it a nationwide public holiday.

item.title: Macron Shares PM Modi's "Fighting On Twitter" Viral Joke

media:content.media:description: PM Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron in Canada

item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has shared a montage of his meetings with world leaders including Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the G7 Summit which took place in Canada's Kananaskis.
item.content:encoded: French President Emmanuel Macron has shared a montage of his meetings with world leaders including Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the G7 Summit which took place in Canada's Kananaskis.

item.title: Ukraine And Russia Exchange Prisoner In Latest Swap

media:content.media:description: The Ukrainian POWs exchanged on Thursday were sick or injured, according to Kyiv.

item.description: Ukraine and Russia exchanged prisoners of war on Thursday, officials from both countries said, the latest round of swaps under an agreement struck in Istanbul.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine and Russia exchanged prisoners of war on Thursday, officials from both countries said, the latest round of swaps under an agreement struck in Istanbul.

item.title: Opinion: Opinion | It Is The Best Of Times, It Is The Worst Of Times, For Pakistan
item.description: While Pakistan has always lived by its wits, this time, it faces the unpredictable, transactionalist Donald Trump, a dealmaker with a penchant for sudden surprises (ask Zelensky).
item.content:encoded: While Pakistan has always lived by its wits, this time, it faces the unpredictable, transactionalist Donald Trump, a dealmaker with a penchant for sudden surprises (ask Zelensky).

item.title: "Saw Missiles, Heard Bombs": Indian Students Recall Iran-Israel Conflict Horror

media:content.media:description: "I hope no student has to face what we did." Ali Akbar, a student from Delhi said.

item.description: "We saw missiles in the sky and heard bombs in our neighbourhood... We were petrified", said MBBS student Mir Khalif as he stepped out of the Delhi airport after being evacuated from war-hit Iran under Operation Sindhu.
item.content:encoded: "We saw missiles in the sky and heard bombs in our neighbourhood... We were petrified", said MBBS student Mir Khalif as he stepped out of the Delhi airport after being evacuated from war-hit Iran under Operation Sindhu.

item.title: 40 Fighter Jets, 100 Bombs: How Israel Struck Iran, Including Key Nuclear Site

media:content.media:description: Israel struck Iran's IR-40 heavy water reactor near the city of Arak.

item.description: The Israeli Air Force (IAF) launched a series of airstrikes deep inside Iranian territory overnight on Wednesday, targeting nuclear infrastructure, missile production sites, and air defence systems.
item.content:encoded: The Israeli Air Force (IAF) launched a series of airstrikes deep inside Iranian territory overnight on Wednesday, targeting nuclear infrastructure, missile production sites, and air defence systems.

item.title: Is Meghan, Duchess Of Sussex, Right? Can Dancing, Twerking Really Bring On Labour?

media:content.media:description: Meghan is not the first woman to report dancing to induce their labour, but this is all anecdotal.

item.description: The video Meghan Markle was made four years ago when she gave birth to daughter Lilibet, but only released recently.
item.content:encoded: The video Meghan Markle was made four years ago when she gave birth to daughter Lilibet, but only released recently.

item.title: "Like Sky Was Torn Open": Iranians Recall Chaotic Scenes In Tehran

media:content.media:description: At the crossing, an AFP correspondent counted several dozen people.

item.description: "The first two days were okay, people said it would just end. But then it started escalating and people really started panicking," said Mehran Ataei of the Israeli bombardment of Tehran.
item.content:encoded: "The first two days were okay, people said it would just end. But then it started escalating and people really started panicking," said Mehran Ataei of the Israeli bombardment of Tehran.

item.title: "Extremely Dangerous": Russia Warns US Against 'Military Intervention' In Iran-Israel War

media:content.media:description: Russia warned the United States against 'military intervention' in Iran-Israel war

item.description: "We would like to particularly warn Washington against military intervention in the situation, which would be an extremely dangerous step with truly unpredictable negative consequences," Russia's foreign ministry's spokeswoman said.
item.content:encoded: "We would like to particularly warn Washington against military intervention in the situation, which would be an extremely dangerous step with truly unpredictable negative consequences," Russia's foreign ministry's spokeswoman said.

item.title: Revolutionary New Drug Offers 99.9% Protection Against HIV

media:content.media:description: Lenacapavir has been shown to reduce the risk of HIV transmission.

item.description: The US FDA has approved lenacapavir, a groundbreaking long-acting HIV prevention drug that offers near-complete protection with just two injections per year. Despite its potential, concerns about high costs may limit its global impact.
item.content:encoded: The US FDA has approved lenacapavir, a groundbreaking long-acting HIV prevention drug that offers near-complete protection with just two injections per year. Despite its potential, concerns about high costs may limit its global impact.
